intro: Petalanthera hispida, commonly known as the rough petalanthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often displaying a variety of colors. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
